intro: Tropaeolum polyphyllum f. schizophyllum, commonly known as the splinter-leaved nasturtium, is a cultivar of the genus Tropaeolum, characterized by its unique foliage. The leaves are deeply lobed and often appear fragmented, giving the plant its common name. It produces bright orange or red flowers with yellow centers, typical of the Tropaeolum genus. The plant is an annual herbaceous species that thrives in warm climates and well-drained soil. It is often grown as an ornamental plant for its vibrant flowers and edible leaves.
